hillbillies.model

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Task>

    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Task>
    Class implementing a task that a unit can execute.
    Invariant:
    The mainStatement must be effective.
        this.getMainStatement() != null

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String name,
            int priority,
            Statement main,
            IntVector selected)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Created a new task.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new task.
        priority - The priority of the new task.
        main - The main statement of the task.
        selected - The position of the selected cube or null if no cube was selected.
        Postconditions:
      • The name will be set.
            new.getName() == name
      • The priority will be set.
            new.getPriority() == priority
      • The selected cube will be set
            new.getSelectedPosition() == selected
      • The schedulers will be empty
            new.getSchedulers().isEmpty()
      • The task won't be running
            !new.isRunning()
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the statement isn't effective. | main == null

 @Immutable
public java.util.Optional<IntVector> getSelectedPosition()
        Optionally returns the selected position.

      • getName

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the task.

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true when the tasks statement is well formed. Only checks break statement as type correctness is checked at construction of statements.
        Returns:
        True if the task is well formed.
            result == this.getMainStatement().checkValid(new BreakChecker()).checkValid()

      • addScheduler

        public void addScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
        Adds a scheduler to the list of schedulers that can assign this task.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The scheduler.
        Postcondition:
        The scheduler will be in the list of schedulers.
            new.getSchedulers().contains(scheduler)

      • removeScheduler

        public void removeScheduler(Scheduler scheduler)
        Removes a scheduler.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The scheduler to remove.
        Postcondition:
        The task won't contain the scheduler.
            !new.getSchedulers().contains(scheduler)

      • getSchedulers

        @Basic
public java.util.Set<Scheduler> getSchedulers()
        Returns the list of schedulers controlling this task.

      • isAssigned

        public boolean isAssigned()
        Returns true when the task is assigned to an unit.
        Returns:
        True if the task is assigned.
            this.getAssignedUnit() != null

      • getAssignedUnit

        @Basic
public Unit getAssignedUnit()
        Returns the assigned unit.

      • setAssignedUnit

        public void setAssignedUnit(Unit assignedUnit)
        Sets the assigned unit.
        Parameters:
        assignedUnit - The new assigned unit.
        Postcondition:
        The task will be assigned the unit.
            new.getAssignedUnit() == assignedUnit

      • getPriority

        @Basic
public int getPriority()
        Returns the priority of the task.

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(int priority)
        Sets the priority of the task.
        Parameters:
        priority - The new priority.
        Postcondition:
        The priority will be set.
            new.getPriority() == priority

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Task o)
        Compares the priority of two tasks.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Task>
        Parameters:
        o - The other task.
        Returns:
        An integer that is positive if this unit has a lower priority than the other unit
            result == o.getPriority() - this.getPriority()

      • advanceTime

        public void advanceTime(double time)
        Runs the task for a certain amount of cycles.
        Parameters:
        time - | The time the task may run for.
        Effects:
      • The mainStatement is ran while we have time left, we are running and it hasn't finish'd yet.
      • The task is interrupted when an other error occurs.
      • The task is ended when a fatal error occurs.

      • isRunning

        @Basic
public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if the task is currently running.

      • await

        public void await()
        Stops the advanceTime loop and waits for the task to be run again.
        Postcondition:
        The task will stop running
            !new.isRunning()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the task to the start state.
        Effect:
        Resets the main statement.
            this.getMainStatement().reset()

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Interrupt this task, making it available for execution by another unit.
        Postconditions:
      • This task will not be assigned.
            !new.isAssigned() && !this.getAssignedUnit().hasAssignedTask()
      • This tasks priority will be decreased by one.
            new.getPriority() == this.getPriority() - 1
        • Effects:
      • The execution will be stopped and reset.
            this.reset()
            this.await()
      • Each scheduler this task belongs to will have its list of tasks rebuild to reflect the change in priority.
            foreach (scheduler in this.getSchedulers()) do (scheduler.rebuildTask(this))

      • getVariable

        @Basic
public java.lang.Object getVariable(java.lang.String variable)
        Returns the Object associated with the variable;
        Parameters:
        variable - The name of the variable.

      • setVariable

        public void setVariable(java.lang.String variable,
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the variable to the given value.
        Parameters:
        variable - The name of the variable.
        value - The new value of the variable.
        Postcondition:
        The value will be set.
            new.getVariable(variable) == value
